text: I'm dr. Susan Love and I'm the chief
visionary officer the dr. Susan Love
Research Foundation our mission is a
future without breast cancer and we do
that through innovative research into
the cause and prevention of the disease
in patient science is a series of videos
that help explain to you breast cancer
how it works and what your choices and
options are your healthcare team may not
be aware of a common type of long term
collateral damage called peripheral
neuropathy or pain and numbness in the
hands and feet neuropathy is a type of
nerve damage that can be caused by
chemotherapy if you have symptoms of
neuropathy during treatment doctors will
typically lower the dose you are getting
that may help but for some patients the
pain and numbness can continue for years
after the treatment ends we know very
little about how long neuropathy can
last and how many breast cancer patients
it affects researchers don't often study
it and doctors don't always ask their
patients about it if you do develop
neuropathy it can have a profound effect
on your quality of life so what can you
do the best option is prevention the
chemotherapy drugs most likely to cause
neuropathy are the taxanes
like taxall and taksa tear if these
drugs are being recommended ask your
doctor if there might be alternatives
you need to weigh the risks and benefits
of each drug if you are older overweight
had a mastectomy or had a high number of
positive lymph nodes your risk of
developing long-term neuropathy may be
higher in this case a conversation with
your doctor will be especially important
a small study recently found that
wearing cooled gloves and socks while
receiving chemotherapy reduced the
amount of drugs the hands and feet
received and therefore the risk for
neuropathy the most important thing is
to talk to your doctor about it it's the
best way to address the collateral
damage that you are experiencing if you
have neuropathy as for a referral to a
palliative care specialist they are the
experts in treating the short and long
term consequences of cancer and his
treatment by talking about your
experiences your doctors will be better
prepared to help you deal with
collateral damage
and improve your quality of life it will
also help them support other cancer
patients and that's something to feel
good about the dr. Susan Love Research
Foundation is dedicated to a future
without breast cancer and we do this
through innovative research into the
cause and prevention of the disease we
ask you to join us at dr. Susan Love
Research org you can participate in our
research you can support our research
because if we all work together we can
be the generation that ends breast
cancer
you
